cluster_relations.rel_desc: The Rhodopis Cinderella tale is identified as the earliest known version of the Cinderella story.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject narrative is a version or variant of the object narrative, distinguished by period, culture, or other features.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: ancient Greece; earlier than later cultural forms
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: ComparativeContext: among various cultural forms told for centuries

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The Cinderella fairytale’s most familiar modern form is identified with Perrault's 1697 version.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject narrative has the object as one of its specific versions or variants.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: FamiliarityStatus: most people are familiar with this version

cluster_relations.rel_desc: German Snow White folklore traditions are described as variations of the Snow White story.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject narrative is a cultural or regional variant of the object narrative, sharing core plot identity with localized differences.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Italian Snow White folklore traditions represent Italian variations of the Snow White tale.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject narrative is a cultural or regional variant of the object narrative, sharing core plot identity with localized differences.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Slavic Snow White folklore traditions are Slavic variants of the Snow White story.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject narrative is a cultural or regional variant of the object narrative, sharing core plot identity with localized differences.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject narrative or tradition is a version or variant of the object narrative, sharing core plot identity with possible differences in period, culture, time, or other features.
args.justification: All four relations describe a specific narrative or narrative tradition as a version/variant of a more general story (e.g., Cinderella, Snow White). Using a single canonical predicate 'is_version_of' with a unified description avoids unnecessary duplication between 'is_variant_of' and 'is_version_of' while capturing that variants are simply culturally or temporally specific versions. The relation class and group already correctly reflect narrative versioning under IDENTITY, so only the canonical name/description need alignment.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject narrative or tradition is a version or variant of the object narrative, sharing core plot identity with possible differences in period, culture, time, or other features.
executed_decisions.justification: All four relations describe a specific narrative or narrative tradition as a version/variant of a more general story (e.g., Cinderella, Snow White). Using a single canonical predicate 'is_version_of' with a unified description avoids unnecessary duplication between 'is_variant_of' and 'is_version_of' while capturing that variants are simply culturally or temporally specific versions. The relation class and group already correctly reflect narrative versioning under IDENTITY, so only the canonical name/description need alignment.
